How is he doing?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word '||Lillebror||' is a compound word made up of '||Lille||' meaning 'little' and '||Bror||' meaning 'brother'.", 'narrator_explanation': "Anna is inquiring about Oskar's little brother, showing interest in his well-being.", 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Din|| means 'your'.", 'target_language': 'Din'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Lillebror|| translates to 'little brother'.", 'target_language': 'lillebror'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Din|| means 'your'. ||Lillebror|| translates to 'little brother'.", 'target_language': 'Din lillebror', 'native_language': 'Your little brother'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Verkar|| means 'seems'.", 'target_language': 'verkar'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Jättehäftig|| means 'really cool'.", 'target_language': 'jättehäftig.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Verkar|| means 'seems'. ||Jättehäftig|| means 'really cool'.", 'target_language': 'verkar jättehäftig.', 'native_language': 'seems really cool.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Hur|| means 'how'.", 'target_language': 'Hur'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Trivs|| means 'is doing' or 'is getting on'.", 'target_language': 'trivs'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Han|| means 'he'.", 'target_language': 'han?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Hur|| means 'how'. ||Trivs|| means 'is doing' or 'is getting on'. ||Han|| means 'he'.", 'target_language': 'Hur trivs han?', 'native_language': 'How is he doing?'}]}, {'target_language': 'Han trivs bra, tack! Fröken säger att hon ser efter honom väl.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': "He's doing well, thanks! The teacher says she looks after him well.", 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word '||fröken||' is often used to address female teachers and comes from the German 'Fräulein', meaning 'Miss'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Oskar responds, assuring that his little brother is well taken care of by his teacher.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Han|| means 'he'.", 'target_language': 'Han'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Trivs|| means 'is doing'.", 'target_language': 'trivs'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Bra|| means 'well'.", 'target_language': 'bra,'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Tack|| means 'thanks'.", 'target_language': 'tack!'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Han|| means 'he'. ||Trivs bra|| means 'is doing well'. ||Tack|| means 'thanks'.", 'target_language': 'Han trivs bra, tack!', 'native_language': "He's doing well, thanks!"}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Fröken|| translates to 'teacher'.", 'target_language': 'Fröken'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Säger|| means 'says'.", 'target_language': 'säger'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'att'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Fröken|| means 'teacher'. ||Säger|| means 'says'. ||Att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'Fröken säger att', 'native_language': 'The teacher says that'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Hon|| means 'she'.", 'target_language': 'hon'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Ser efter|| means 'looks after'.", 'target_language': 'ser efter'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Honom|| means 'him'.", 'target_language': 'honom'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Väl|| means 'well'.", 'target_language': 'väl.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Hon|| means 'she'. ||Ser efter|| means 'looks after'. ||Honom|| means 'him'. ||Väl|| means 'well'.", 'target_language': 'hon ser efter honom väl.', 'native_language': 'she looks after him well.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Vad bra! Jag önskar att jag kunde se dem ofta.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': "That's great! I wish I could see them often.", 'narrator_fun_fact': "In Swedish, '||önskar||' means 'wish' and is often used when expressing a desire or hope.", 'narrator_explanation': "Anna expresses her happiness about Oskar's little brother and her desire to see them more frequently.", 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Vad|| means 'what'.", 'target_language': 'Vad'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Bra|| means 'great'.", 'target_language': 'bra!'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Vad|| means 'what'. ||Bra|| means 'great'. The combination is equivalent to 'That's great!'.", 'target_language': 'Vad bra!', 'native_language': "That's great!"}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Jag|| means 'I'.", 'target_language': 'Jag'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Önskar|| means 'wish'.", 'target_language': 'önskar'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'att'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Jag|| means 'I'. ||Önskar|| means 'wish'. ||Att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'Jag önskar att jag', 'native_language': 'I wish I'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Kunde|| means 'could'.", 'target_language': 'kunde'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Se|| means 'see'.", 'target_language': 'se'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Dem|| means 'them'.", 'target_language': 'dem'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Ofta|| means 'often'.", 'target_language': 'ofta.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Kunde|| means 'could'. ||Se|| means 'see'. ||Dem|| means 'them'. ||Ofta|| means 'often'.", 'target_language': 'kunde se dem ofta.', 'native_language': 'could see them often.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Du kan alltid hälsa på när du är framme. Vi tar hand om honom då.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': "You can always visit when you arrive. We'll take care of him then.", 'narrator_fun_fact': "The phrase '||hälsa på||', meaning 'to visit', literally translates to 'greet on'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Oskar offers Anna the opportunity to visit and assures her that they can take care of his brother together.', 'turn_nr': '4', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'You'.", 'target_language': 'Du'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Kan alltid|| means 'always can'.", 'target_language': 'kan alltid'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hälsa på|| means 'visit'.", 'target_language': 'hälsa på'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'You'. ||Kan alltid|| means 'always can'. ||Hälsa på|| means 'visit'.", 'target_language': 'Du kan alltid hälsa på', 'native_language': 'You can always visit'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||När|| means 'when'.", 'target_language': 'när'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'you'.", 'target_language': 'du'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Är framme|| means 'arrive'.", 'target_language': 'är framme.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||När|| means 'when'. ||Du är framme|| means 'you arrive'.", 'target_language': 'när du är framme.', 'native_language': 'when you arrive.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'.", 'target_language': 'Vi'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Tar hand om|| means 'take care of'.", 'target_language': 'tar hand om'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Honom|| means 'him'.", 'target_language': 'honom'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Då|| means 'then'.", 'target_language': 'då.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'. ||Tar hand om|| means 'take care of'. ||Honom|| means 'him'. ||Då|| means 'then'.", 'target_language': 'Vi tar hand om honom då.', 'native_language': "We'll take care of him then."}]}]

title: Two Strangers Walking Their Dogs
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Schönes Wetter heute, oder?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': "Nice weather today, isn't it?", 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||Wetter|| in German means 'weather'. It comes from Old High German 'wetar', which relates to wind and storm.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Hans is commenting on the nice weather.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Schönes|| means 'nice'.", 'target_language': 'Schönes'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Wetter|| means 'weather'.", 'target_language': 'Wetter'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Schönes Wetter|| means 'nice weather'.", 'target_language': 'Schönes Wetter', 'native_language': 'Nice weather'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Heute|| means 'today'.", 'target_language': 'heute'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Heute|| means 'today'.", 'target_language': 'heute', 'native_language': 'today'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Oder|| means 'or', used here as 'isn't it?'.", 'target_language': 'oder?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Oder|| translates to 'or', and in this context it means 'isn't it?'.", 'target_language': 'oder?', 'native_language': "isn't it?"}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, wirklich schön. Gehst du oft hier spazieren?', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Yes, really nice. Do you walk here often?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The German word ||spazieren|| means 'to walk'. It comes from the French verb 'se promener'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Greta is agreeing with Hans and asking if he often goes for walks here.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Wirklich|| means 'really'.", 'target_language': 'wirklich'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Schön|| means 'nice'.", 'target_language': 'schön'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'yes'. ||Wirklich|| means 'really'. ||Schön|| means 'nice'.", 'target_language': 'Ja, wirklich schön.', 'native_language': 'Yes, really nice.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Gehst|| means 'walk'.", 'target_language': 'Gehst'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'you'.", 'target_language': 'du'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Oft|| means 'often'.", 'target_language': 'oft'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Gehst|| means 'walk'. ||Du|| means 'you'. ||Oft|| means 'often'.", 'target_language': 'Gehst du oft', 'native_language': 'Do you walk often'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Hier|| means 'here'.", 'target_language': 'hier'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Spazieren|| means 'to walk'.", 'target_language': 'spazieren?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Hier|| means 'here'. ||Spazieren|| means 'to walk'.", 'target_language': 'hier spazieren?', 'native_language': 'here?'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, fast jeden Tag. Dein Hund ist süß!', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Yes, almost every day. Your dog is cute!', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||Hund|| means 'dog' in German. It is related to the English word 'hound' and has old Germanic roots.", 'narrator_explanation': "Hans mentions he walks almost every day and compliments Greta's dog.", 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Fast|| means 'almost'.", 'target_language': 'fast'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Jeden Tag|| means 'every day'.", 'target_language': 'jeden Tag.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'yes'. ||Fast|| means 'almost'. ||Jeden Tag|| means 'every day'.", 'target_language': 'Ja, fast jeden Tag.', 'native_language': 'Yes, almost every day.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Dein|| means 'your'.", 'target_language': 'Dein'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hund|| means 'dog'.", 'target_language': 'Hund'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Ist|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'ist'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Süß|| means 'cute' or 'sweet'.", 'target_language': 'süß!'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Dein|| means 'your'. ||Hund|| means 'dog'. ||Ist|| means 'is'. ||Süß|| means 'cute'.", 'target_language': 'Dein Hund ist süß!', 'native_language': 'Your dog is cute!'}]}, {'target_language': 'Danke! Deiner auch.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Thank you! Yours too.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||Danke|| means 'thank you' in German. It is derived from the old German term 'thankon', which means to think or to feel grateful.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Greta thanks Hans and reciprocates the compliment.', 'turn_nr': '4', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Danke|| translates to 'thank you'.", 'target_language': 'Danke!'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Danke|| translates to 'thank you'.", 'target_language': 'Danke!', 'native_language': 'Thank you!'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Deiner|| means 'yours'.", 'target_language': 'Deiner'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Auch|| means 'also' or 'too'.", 'target_language': 'auch.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Deiner|| means 'yours'. ||Auch|| means 'also' or 'too'.", 'target_language': 'Deiner auch.', 'native_language': 'Yours too.'}]}]

title: A Flight Attendant Helping a Passenger with a Wheelchair
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'お客様、車椅子の準備ができています。どうぞご利用ください。', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Dear passenger, the wheelchair is ready. Please feel free to use it.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||車椅子|| (kuruma-isu) translates to 'wheelchair' in English and is composed of two characters: ||車|| (kuruma), meaning 'car' or 'vehicle', and ||椅子|| (isu), meaning 'chair'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Yui is informing Takashi that the wheelchair he requested is ready for use.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': '||お|| is an honorific prefix used for politeness.', 'target_language': 'お'}, {'narrator_translation': "||客様|| means 'guest' or 'customer.'", 'target_language': '客様'}], 'narrator_translation': "||お客様|| means 'dear passenger' or 'customer.'", 'target_language': 'お客様', 'native_language': 'Dear passenger'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||車椅子|| translates to 'wheelchair.'", 'target_language': '車椅子'}, {'narrator_translation': "||準備|| means 'preparation.'", 'target_language': '準備'}, {'narrator_translation': '||が|| is a particle that marks the subject of the sentence.', 'target_language': 'が'}, {'narrator_translation': "||できています|| means 'is ready.'", 'target_language': 'できています'}], 'narrator_translation': "||車椅子の準備|| means 'wheelchair preparation.'. ||ができています|| means 'is ready.'", 'target_language': '車椅子の準備ができています', 'native_language': 'the wheelchair is ready'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||どうぞ|| means 'please.'", 'target_language': 'どうぞ'}, {'narrator_translation': "||ご利用ください|| means 'feel free to use it.'", 'target_language': 'ご利用ください'}], 'narrator_translation': "||どうぞ|| means 'please.'. ||ご利用ください|| means 'feel free to use it.'.", 'target_language': 'どうぞご利用ください', 'native_language': 'Please feel free to use it.'}]}, {'target_language': 'ありがとうございます。手伝っていただけますか？', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Thank you. Can you assist me, please?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||助かります|| (tasukarimasu) comes from the verb ||助かる|| (tasukaru), which means 'to be helped' or 'to be saved'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Takashi is thanking Yui and asking for her assistance.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||ありがとう|| means 'thank you.'", 'target_language': 'ありがとう'}, {'narrator_translation': '||ございます|| adds politeness to ||ありがとう||.', 'target_language': 'ございます'}], 'narrator_translation': '||ありがとうございます|| is a standard way to say ‘thank you’ in Japanese.', 'target_language': 'ありがとうございます', 'native_language': 'Thank you'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||手伝って|| means 'assist.'", 'target_language': '手伝って'}, {'narrator_translation': "||いただけますか|| means 'can you please.'", 'target_language': 'いただけますか'}], 'narrator_translation': "||手伝って|| means 'assist.'. ||いただけますか|| means 'can you please.'.", 'target_language': '手伝っていただけますか？', 'native_language': 'Can you assist me, please?'}]}, {'target_language': 'もちろんです。安全のためにベルトを締めてください。', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Of course. Please fasten the belt for safety.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The phrase ||もちろん|| (mochiron) means 'of course' and is often used to affirm a statement or request.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Yui agrees to assist Takashi and advises him to fasten the belt for safety reasons.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||もちろん|| means 'of course.'", 'target_language': 'もちろん'}, {'narrator_translation': '||です|| is a copula used for politeness.', 'target_language': 'です'}], 'narrator_translation': "||もちろんです|| means 'Of course.'", 'target_language': 'もちろんです', 'native_language': 'Of course'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||安全|| means 'safety.'", 'target_language': '安全'}, {'narrator_translation': "||のために|| means 'for the purpose of.'", 'target_language': 'のために'}], 'narrator_translation': "||安全のために|| means 'for safety.'", 'target_language': '安全のために', 'native_language': 'for safety'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||ベルト|| means 'belt.'", 'target_language': 'ベルト'}, {'narrator_translation': "||締めてください|| means 'please fasten.'", 'target_language': '締めてください'}], 'narrator_translation': "||ベルト|| means 'belt.'. ||を締めてください|| means 'please fasten.'.", 'target_language': 'ベルトを締めてください', 'native_language': 'please fasten the belt'}]}, {'target_language': '分かりました。助かります。', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Understood. This is very helpful.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||分かりました|| (wakarimashita) comes from the verb ||分かる|| (wakaru), meaning 'to understand'.", 'narrator_explanation': "Takashi acknowledges Yui's instructions and expresses gratitude for the help.", 'turn_nr': '4', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||分かりました|| means 'Understood.'", 'target_language': '分かりました'}], 'narrator_translation': "||分かりました|| means 'Understood.'", 'target_language': '分かりました', 'native_language': 'Understood'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||助かります|| means 'This is very helpful.'", 'target_language': '助かります'}], 'narrator_translation': "||助かります|| means 'This is very helpful.'", 'target_language': '助かります', 'native_language': 'This is very helpful.'}]}]

title: Thanks to
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Tack vare din hjälp kunde jag slutföra projektet.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Thanks to your help, I was able to complete the project.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The phrase ||Tack vare|| translates directly to 'Thanks to,' indicating the cause or reason. The word ||slutföra|| is a compound word, where ||slut|| means 'end' or 'finish' and ||föra|| translates to 'lead' or 'carry', together they mean 'to complete'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Oskar is thanking Eva because her assistance was crucial for him to complete his project.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Tack|| means 'Thanks'.", 'target_language': 'Tack'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Vare|| translates to 'due to'.", 'target_language': 'vare'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Tack vare|| means 'Thanks to', used to express gratitude for someone's contribution.", 'target_language': 'Tack vare', 'native_language': 'Thanks to'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Din|| translates to 'your'.", 'target_language': 'din'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hjälp|| means 'help'.", 'target_language': 'hjälp'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Din hjälp|| means 'your help'. ||Din|| is a possessive pronoun and ||hjälp|| means 'help'.", 'target_language': 'din hjälp', 'native_language': 'your help'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Kunde|| means 'was able to'.", 'target_language': 'kunde'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Jag|| means 'I'.", 'target_language': 'jag'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Kunde|| translates to 'was able to' and ||jag|| means 'I'.", 'target_language': 'kunde jag', 'native_language': 'I was able to'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Slutföra|| means 'to finish' or 'complete'.", 'target_language': 'slutföra'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Projektet|| means 'the project'.", 'target_language': 'projektet.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Slutföra|| means 'complete' and ||projektet|| translates to 'the project'.", 'target_language': 'slutföra projektet.', 'native_language': 'complete the project.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Det var inget. Du är alltid så upptagen, så jag ville gärna hjälpa till.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'It was nothing. You are always so busy, so I wanted to help.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||inget|| means 'nothing'. It is derived from the Old Norse ||engi||, which means 'none'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Eva humbly downplays her contribution and explains that she saw Oskar was very busy.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Det|| translates to 'It'.", 'target_language': 'Det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Var|| means 'was'.", 'target_language': 'var'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Inget|| means 'nothing'.", 'target_language': 'inget.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Det var inget|| means 'It was nothing'. ||Det|| translates to 'It'. ||Var|| means 'was'. ||Inget|| means 'nothing'.", 'target_language': 'Det var inget.', 'native_language': 'It was nothing.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'You'.", 'target_language': 'Du'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Är|| means 'are'.", 'target_language': 'är'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Alltid|| means 'always'.", 'target_language': 'alltid'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Så upptagen|| means 'so busy'.", 'target_language': 'så upptagen,'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Du är|| means 'You are'. ||Alltid så upptagen|| translates to 'always so busy'.", 'target_language': 'Du är alltid så upptagen,', 'native_language': 'You are always so busy,'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Så|| means 'so'.", 'target_language': 'så'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Jag|| means 'I'.", 'target_language': 'jag'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Ville gärna|| translates to 'wanted to'.", 'target_language': 'ville gärna'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hjälpa till|| means 'help'.", 'target_language': 'hjälpa till.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Så jag ville gärna|| translates to 'so I wanted to'. ||Hjälpa till|| means 'help'.", 'target_language': 'så jag ville gärna hjälpa till.', 'native_language': 'so I wanted to help.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, på senare tid har det varit mycket att göra. Tack än en gång.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Yes, lately there has been a lot to do. Thanks again.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||mycket|| can mean 'much' or 'a lot' depending on context. It shares a root with the English word ||much||.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Oskar acknowledges his busy schedule and expresses gratitude once more.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'Yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja,'}, {'narrator_translation': "||På senare tid|| translates to 'lately'.", 'target_language': 'på senare tid'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'Yes'. ||På senare tid|| translates to 'lately'.", 'target_language': 'Ja, på senare tid', 'native_language': 'Yes, lately'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Har|| means 'has'.", 'target_language': 'har'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'it' or 'there'.", 'target_language': 'det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Varit|| means 'been'.", 'target_language': 'varit'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Mycket|| means 'a lot'.", 'target_language': 'mycket'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Att göra|| translates to 'to do'.", 'target_language': 'att göra.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Har det varit|| translates to 'there has been'. ||Mycket att göra|| means 'a lot to do'.", 'target_language': 'har det varit mycket att göra.', 'native_language': 'there has been a lot to do.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Tack|| means 'Thanks'.", 'target_language': 'Tack'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Än en gång|| translates to 'again' or 'once again'.", 'target_language': 'än en gång.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Tack än en gång|| means 'Thanks again'. ||Än en gång|| translates to 'once again'.", 'target_language': 'Tack än en gång.', 'native_language': 'Thanks again.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Inget problem! dialogue: [{'target_language': 'I min mening är detta en stor utmaning.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'In my opinion, this is a big challenge.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word 'utmaning' is derived from the verb 'utmana', which means 'to challenge'. title: What is Necessary
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Vad är nödvändigt för att slutföra projektet?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'What is necessary to complete the project?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "In Swedish, the word 'nödvändigt' is derived from 'nöd', meaning 'need' or 'necessity', and 'vändigt', which comes from 'vända', meaning 'to turn'. It comes from Old Swedish 'litha', meaning 'lean on' or 'depend on'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Erik expresses concern about whether their request for more time will be approved.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Kan|| means 'Can'.", 'target_language': 'Kan'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'.", 'target_language': 'vi'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Lita|| means 'trust'.", 'target_language': 'lita'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Kan|| means 'Can'. ||Vi|| means 'we'. ||Lita|| means 'trust'.", 'target_language': 'Kan vi lita', 'native_language': 'Can we trust'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||På att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'på att'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'it'.", 'target_language': 'det'}], 'narrator_translation': "||På att|| means 'that'. ||Det|| means 'it'.", 'target_language': 'på att det', 'native_language': 'that it'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Blir|| means 'will be'.", 'target_language': 'blir'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Tillåtet|| means 'allowed'.", 'target_language': 'tillåtet?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Blir|| means 'will be'. ||Tillåtet|| means 'allowed'.", 'target_language': 'blir tillåtet?', 'native_language': 'will be allowed?'}]}, {'target_language': 'Jag hoppas det, annars kommer projektet att dö.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'I hope so, otherwise the project will die.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word 'hoppas' in Swedish comes from the Old Norse 'hoppa', meaning 'to hope'. title: Crime Conversation
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Jag hörde att någon blev skjuten i natt.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'I heard someone was shot last night.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||skjuten|| means 'shot' in Swedish. title: Education as an Investment
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Jag tror att utbildning är en bra investering för framtiden.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'I think education is a good investment for the future.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word for 'education' is ||utbildning||. title: Feeling Proud of a Painting
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Vad tycker du om mitt senaste konstverk?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'What do you think about my latest artwork?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word ||konstverk|| is a compound word made from ||konst||, meaning 'art', and ||verk||, meaning 'work'. title: It's Raining Outside
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Vi kan inte gå ut idag. Det regnar.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': "We can't go out today. It's raining.", 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word ||regnar|| means 'raining'. It is derived from the Old Norse word ||regna||, which also means 'to rain'.", 'narrator_explanation': "Emma is informing Oskar that they can't go outside due to the rain.", 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'narrator_translation': "||Vi kan inte|| means 'We can't'.", 'target_language': 'Vi kan inte', 'native_language': "We can't"}, {'narrator_translation': "||Gå ut|| means 'go out'.", 'target_language': 'gå ut', 'native_language': 'go out'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Idag|| means 'today'.", 'target_language': 'idag.', 'native_language': 'today.'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det regnar|| means 'It's raining'.", 'target_language': 'Det regnar.', 'native_language': "It's raining."}]}, {'target_language': 'Åh, vilken skam. I really wanted to go for a walk.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish phrase ||vilken skam|| translates to 'what a shame'. ||Skam|| means 'shame' or 'pity' and is derived from the Old Norse word ||skömm||, meaning 'disgrace'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Oskar expresses his disappointment about not being able to go for a walk.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'narrator_translation': "||Åh|| means 'Oh'. ||Vilken skam|| means 'what a shame'.", 'target_language': 'Åh, vilken skam.', 'native_language': 'Oh, such a shame.'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Jag ville verkligen|| means 'I really wanted'.", 'target_language': 'Jag ville verkligen', 'native_language': 'I really wanted'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Gå en promenad|| means 'to go for a walk'.", 'target_language': 'gå en promenad.', 'native_language': 'to go for a walk.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, men vi får stanna inne på grund av vädret.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Yes, but we have to stay inside because of the weather.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word ||vädret|| translates to 'the weather'. It stems from the Old Norse word ||vedr||, which also denotes weather or storm.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Emma agrees but mentions they need to stay indoors due to the weather.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja, men vi får|| means 'Yes, but we have to'.", 'target_language': 'Ja, men vi får', 'native_language': 'Yes, but we have to'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Stanna inne|| means 'stay inside'.", 'target_language': 'stanna inne', 'native_language': 'stay inside'}, {'narrator_translation': "||På grund av vädret|| means 'because of the weather'.", 'target_language': 'på grund av vädret.', 'native_language': 'because of the weather.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, tack vare regnet kan vi läsa en bok istället.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Yes, thanks to the rain, we can read a book instead.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word ||regnet|| means 'the rain'. It is related to the Old Norse term ||regn||.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Oskar is looking on the bright side, suggesting they can read a book instead due to the rain.', 'turn_nr': '4', 'split_sentence': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja, tack vare regnet|| means 'Yes, thanks to the rain'.", 'target_language': 'Ja, tack vare regnet', 'native_language': 'Yes, thanks to the rain'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Kan vi läsa|| means 'we can read'.", 'target_language': 'kan vi läsa', 'native_language': 'we can read'}, {'narrator_translation': "||En bok istället|| means 'a book instead'.", 'target_language': 'en bok istället.', 'native_language': 'a book instead.'}]}]

title: Two Friends Gossiping
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Hast du gehört, was mit Maria passiert ist?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Did you hear what happened to Maria?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||gehört|| comes from the verb ||hören||, which means 'to hear'. It is related to the English word 'hear', which also originates from the Germanic root.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Anna is asking Laura if she has heard the news about Maria.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Hast|| means 'did have'.", 'target_language': 'Hast'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'you'.", 'target_language': 'du'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Gehört|| translates to 'heard'.", 'target_language': 'gehört'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Hast|| means 'did have'. ||Du|| means 'you'. ||Gehört|| translates to 'heard'.", 'target_language': 'Hast du gehört', 'native_language': 'Did you hear'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Was|| translates to 'what'.", 'target_language': 'was'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Mit|| means 'with'.", 'target_language': 'mit'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Maria|| is 'Maria'.", 'target_language': 'Maria'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Passiert|| means 'happened'.", 'target_language': 'passiert'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Ist|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'ist?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Was|| translates to 'what'. ||Mit|| means 'with'. ||Maria|| is 'Maria'. ||Passiert|| means 'happened'. ||Ist|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'was mit Maria passiert ist?', 'native_language': 'what happened to Maria?'}]}, {'target_language': 'Nein, was ist passiert?', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'No, what happened?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The German word ||Nein|| is used to say 'No'. It is used in similar contexts to refer to employment or tasks.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Anna is telling Laura that Maria got a new job, but it’s a mystery where it is.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Sie|| means 'She'.", 'target_language': 'Sie'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hat|| means 'has'.", 'target_language': 'hat'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Einen neuen Job|| means 'a new job'.", 'target_language': 'einen neuen Job'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Bekommen|| means 'got'.", 'target_language': 'bekommen'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Sie|| means 'She'. ||Hat|| means 'has'. ||Einen neuen Job|| means 'a new job'. ||Bekommen|| means 'got'.", 'target_language': 'Sie hat einen neuen Job bekommen', 'native_language': 'She got a new job'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Aber|| means 'but'.", 'target_language': 'aber'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Keiner|| means 'nobody'.", 'target_language': 'keiner'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Weiß|| translates to 'knows'.", 'target_language': 'weiß'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Wo|| means 'where'.", 'target_language': 'wo.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Aber|| means 'but'. ||Keiner|| means 'nobody'. ||Weiß|| translates to 'knows'. ||Wo|| means 'where'.", 'target_language': 'aber keiner weiß, wo.', 'native_language': 'but nobody knows where.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Oh, das ist interessant. I wonder why she is keeping it a secret.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||verheimlicht|| translates to 'keeps secret'. title: Discussing Dream Professions

title: A Walk on the Moon
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Har du någonsin drömt om att gå på månen?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Have you ever dreamed of walking on the moon?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "||Drömt|| means 'dreamed' and is the past participle of ||drömma||, which means 'to dream'. The word comes from Old Norse ||draumr||, which also means 'dream'.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Lars is asking Eva if she has ever dreamed of walking on the moon.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Har|| means 'have'.", 'target_language': 'Har'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'you'.", 'target_language': 'du'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Någonsin|| means 'ever'.", 'target_language': 'någonsin'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Har|| means 'have'. ||Du|| means 'you'. ||Någonsin|| means 'ever'.", 'target_language': 'Har du någonsin', 'native_language': 'Have you ever'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Drömt|| means 'dreamed'.", 'target_language': 'drömt'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Om|| means 'of'.", 'target_language': 'om'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Att gå|| means 'to walk'.", 'target_language': 'att gå'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Drömt|| means 'dreamed'. ||Om|| means 'of'. ||Att gå|| means 'to walk'.", 'target_language': 'drömt om att gå', 'native_language': 'dreamed of walking'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||På|| means 'on'.", 'target_language': 'på'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Månen|| means 'moon'.", 'target_language': 'månen?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||På|| means 'on'. ||Månen|| means 'moon'.", 'target_language': 'på månen?', 'native_language': 'on the moon?'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, jag undrar hur det skulle kännas under mina fötter.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Yes, I wonder how it would feel under my feet.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish word ||under|| means 'under' or 'below'. It's derived from the Proto-Germanic ||undar||, carrying the same meaning.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Eva is responding to Lars by saying that she has thought about how it would feel to walk on the moon.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Jag undrar|| means 'I wonder'.", 'target_language': 'jag undrar'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'yes'. ||Jag undrar|| means 'I wonder'.", 'target_language': 'Ja, jag undrar', 'native_language': 'Yes, I wonder'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Hur|| means 'how'.", 'target_language': 'hur'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det skulle kännas|| means 'it would feel'.", 'target_language': 'det skulle kännas'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Hur|| means 'how'. ||Det skulle kännas|| means 'it would feel'.", 'target_language': 'hur det skulle kännas', 'native_language': 'how it would feel'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Under|| means 'under'.", 'target_language': 'under'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Mina fötter|| means 'my feet'.", 'target_language': 'mina fötter.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Under|| means 'under'. ||Mina fötter|| means 'my feet'.", 'target_language': 'under mina fötter.', 'native_language': 'under my feet.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Det skulle vara fantastiskt att se jorden från månen. Med egna ögon!', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'It would be amazing to see the Earth from the moon. With my own eyes!', 'narrator_fun_fact': "In Swedish, the word ||fantastiskt|| means 'fantastic' or 'amazing'. It shares roots with words in many other European languages, stemming from the Latin ||fantasticus||.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Lars expresses his excitement about the idea of seeing Earth from the moon.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'it'.", 'target_language': 'Det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Skulle vara|| means 'would be'.", 'target_language': 'skulle vara'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Det skulle vara|| means 'it would be'.", 'target_language': 'Det skulle vara', 'native_language': 'It would be'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Fantastiskt|| means 'amazing'.", 'target_language': 'fantastiskt'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Att se|| means 'to see'.", 'target_language': 'att se'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Fantastiskt|| means 'amazing'. ||Att se|| means 'to see'.", 'target_language': 'fantastiskt att se', 'native_language': 'amazing to see'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Jorden|| means 'Earth'.", 'target_language': 'jorden'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Från|| means 'from'.", 'target_language': 'från'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Månen|| means 'moon'.", 'target_language': 'månen.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Jorden från månen|| means 'the Earth from the moon'.", 'target_language': 'jorden från månen.', 'native_language': 'the Earth from the moon.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Med|| means 'with'.", 'target_language': 'Med'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Egna ögon|| means 'own eyes'.", 'target_language': 'egna ögon!'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Med|| means 'with'. ||Egna ögon|| means 'own eyes'.", 'target_language': 'Med egna ögon!', 'native_language': 'With my own eyes!'}]}, {'target_language': 'Tänk att bara höra tystnaden med bara sina öron. title: The Importance of Protecting Endangered Species

title: Private Conversation
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Den här platsen känns så tom.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'This place feels so empty.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "In Swedish, the word ||plats|| means 'place.' It's derived from the Old High German word ||plazza||, meaning 'a wide, open area.' The word ||tom|| means 'empty,' and its etymology traces back to Old Norse ||tǫmr||, meaning 'devoid of content.'", 'narrator_explanation': 'Anna and Erik are visiting a venue and noticing how empty it feels.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Den|| translates to 'this' or 'the'.", 'target_language': 'Den'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Här|| translates to 'here'.", 'target_language': 'här'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Platsen|| translates to 'place'.", 'target_language': 'platsen'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Den här platsen|| can be translated as 'this place' in English.", 'target_language': 'Den här platsen', 'native_language': 'This place'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Känns|| translates to 'feels'.", 'target_language': 'känns'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Så|| translates to 'so'.", 'target_language': 'så'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Tom|| translates to 'empty'.", 'target_language': 'tom.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Känns så tom|| translates to 'feels so empty' in English.", 'target_language': 'känns så tom.', 'native_language': 'feels so empty.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, det är konstigt. Ingen annan är här.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Yes, it is strange. No one else is here.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The phrase ||Ingen annan|| in Swedish means 'no one else.' The word ||ingen|| is derived from Old Norse ||engi||, which means 'none.' The word ||annan|| means 'other' or 'another.'", 'narrator_explanation': 'Erik agrees with Anna and finds it strange that the place is empty.', 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'Yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'Yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja', 'native_language': 'Yes'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'it'.", 'target_language': 'det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Är|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'är'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Konstigt|| translates to 'strange'.", 'target_language': 'konstigt'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Det är konstigt|| translates to 'it is strange'.", 'target_language': 'det är konstigt.', 'native_language': 'it is strange.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ingen|| translates to 'No one'.", 'target_language': 'Ingen'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Annan|| means 'else' or 'other'.", 'target_language': 'annan'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Är|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'är'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Här|| means 'here'.", 'target_language': 'här.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ingen annan|| translates to 'No one else'. ||Är här|| translates to 'is here'.", 'target_language': 'Ingen annan är här.', 'native_language': 'No one else is here.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Tror du att det är för att det är för dyrt?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': "Do you think it's because it's too expensive?", 'narrator_fun_fact': "The Swedish verb ||tror|| means 'to believe' or 'to think' and comes from Old Norse ||trúa||, which means 'to trust.' The word ||dyrt|| means 'expensive' and is derived from the Old Norse ||dýrr||.", 'narrator_explanation': "Anna wonders if the place is empty because it's too expensive.", 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Tror|| means 'think'.", 'target_language': 'Tror'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Du|| means 'you'.", 'target_language': 'du'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Tror|| means 'think'. ||Du|| means 'you'.", 'target_language': 'Tror du', 'native_language': 'Do you think'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'att'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'it'.", 'target_language': 'det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Är|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'är'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Att det är|| means 'that it is'.", 'target_language': 'att det är', 'native_language': 'that it is'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||För|| means 'for'.", 'target_language': 'för'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Att|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'att'}], 'narrator_translation': "||För att|| means 'because'.", 'target_language': 'för att', 'native_language': 'because'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'it'.", 'target_language': 'det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Är|| means 'is'.", 'target_language': 'är'}, {'narrator_translation': "||För|| means 'too'.", 'target_language': 'för'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Dyrt|| means 'expensive'.", 'target_language': 'dyrt.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Det är för dyrt|| means 'it is too expensive'.", 'target_language': 'det är för dyrt.', 'native_language': "it's too expensive."}]}, {'target_language': 'Kanske. title: Strange Noise
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Hörde du det där konstiga ljudet?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Did you hear that strange noise?', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||konstig|| meaning 'strange' or 'odd', comes from the noun ||konst||, which means 'art.' title: Visiting and Discovering New Places
dialogue: [{'target_language': 'Ska vi besöka det nya museet i helgen?', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Shall we visit the new museum this weekend?', 'narrator_fun_fact': 'In Swedish, the word ||museum|| is borrowed from Latin, similar to English. It retains the same meaning.', 'narrator_explanation': 'Erik is suggesting a visit to a new museum over the coming weekend.', 'turn_nr': '1', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ska|| translates to 'shall' or 'will'.", 'target_language': 'Ska'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'.", 'target_language': 'vi'}], 'narrator_translation': '||Ska vi|| is a way to suggest an activity in Swedish.', 'target_language': 'Ska vi', 'native_language': 'Shall we'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Besöka|| translates to 'visit'.", 'target_language': 'besöka'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det nya|| means 'the new'.", 'target_language': 'det nya'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Museet|| translates to 'museum'.", 'target_language': 'museet'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Besöka|| means 'visit'. ||Det nya museet|| translates to 'the new museum'.", 'target_language': 'besöka det nya museet', 'native_language': 'visit the new museum'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||I|| means 'in' or 'this'.", 'target_language': 'i'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Helgen|| means 'weekend'.", 'target_language': 'helgen?'}], 'narrator_translation': "||I helgen|| translates to 'this weekend'.", 'target_language': 'i helgen?', 'native_language': 'this weekend?'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja, det låter kul! Vi kan hälsa på min kusin som bor där också.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Yes, that sounds fun! We can also visit my cousin who lives there.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The word ||kusin|| in Swedish is similar to the French word 'cousin,' showing the influence of French on many European languages.", 'narrator_explanation': "Sofia agrees to Erik's plan and suggests an additional visit to her cousin.", 'turn_nr': '2', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'Yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja,'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Det|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'det'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Låter kul!|| means 'sounds fun!'.", 'target_language': 'låter kul!'}], 'narrator_translation': '||Ja, det låter kul!|| is an expression indicating agreement and excitement.', 'target_language': 'Ja, det låter kul!', 'native_language': 'Yes, that sounds fun!'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'.", 'target_language': 'Vi'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Kan|| means 'can'.", 'target_language': 'kan'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hälsa på|| translates to 'visit'.", 'target_language': 'hälsa på'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Min|| means 'my'.", 'target_language': 'min'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Kusin|| translates to 'cousin'.", 'target_language': 'kusin'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Vi kan hälsa på|| means 'we can visit'. ||Min kusin|| means 'my cousin'.", 'target_language': 'Vi kan hälsa på min kusin', 'native_language': 'We can visit my cousin'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Som|| translates to 'who'.", 'target_language': 'som'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Bor|| means 'lives'.", 'target_language': 'bor'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Där|| means 'there'.", 'target_language': 'där'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Också|| means 'also'.", 'target_language': 'också.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Som bor där också|| translates directly to 'who lives there also'.", 'target_language': 'som bor där också.', 'native_language': 'who lives there.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Perfekt. Jag hoppas vi upptäcker något intressant.', 'speaker': 'speaker_1', 'native_language': 'Perfect. I hope we discover something interesting.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "'Interesting' in Swedish is ||intressant||, sharing a similar pronunciation with its English counterpart, showing the shared Latin roots.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Erik expresses his hope to find something fascinating during their visit.', 'turn_nr': '3', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Perfekt|| means 'Perfect'.", 'target_language': 'Perfekt.'}], 'narrator_translation': '||Perfekt|| is used similarly to English as a response to confirm satisfaction.', 'target_language': 'Perfekt.', 'native_language': 'Perfect.'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Jag|| means 'I'.", 'target_language': 'Jag'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Hoppas|| means 'hope'.", 'target_language': 'hoppas'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'.", 'target_language': 'vi'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Upptäcker|| means 'discover'.", 'target_language': 'upptäcker'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Jag hoppas|| means 'I hope'. ||Vi upptäcker|| means 'we discover'.", 'target_language': 'Jag hoppas vi upptäcker', 'native_language': 'I hope we discover'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Något|| means 'something'.", 'target_language': 'något'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Intressant|| means 'interesting'.", 'target_language': 'intressant.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Något|| means 'something'. ||Intressant|| means 'interesting'.", 'target_language': 'något intressant.', 'native_language': 'something interesting.'}]}, {'target_language': 'Ja! Sen kan vi äta middag på restaurangen som har dykt upp nyligen.', 'speaker': 'speaker_2', 'native_language': 'Yes! Then we can have dinner at the restaurant that has recently appeared.', 'narrator_fun_fact': "The phrase 'has recently appeared' in Swedish is ||har dykt upp nyligen||, where 'dykt upp' means 'appeared' and originates from 'dive up', illustrating a visual of emerging.", 'narrator_explanation': 'Sofia proposes having dinner at a new restaurant in the area.', 'turn_nr': '4', 'split_sentence': [{'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| means 'Yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja!'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Ja|| simply means 'Yes'.", 'target_language': 'Ja!', 'native_language': 'Yes!'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||Sen|| means 'Then'.", 'target_language': 'Sen'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Kan|| means 'can'.", 'target_language': 'kan'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Vi|| means 'we'.", 'target_language': 'vi'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Äta|| means 'eat'.", 'target_language': 'äta'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Middag|| means 'dinner'.", 'target_language': 'middag'}], 'narrator_translation': "||Sen kan vi|| means 'Then we can'. ||Äta middag|| means 'have dinner'.", 'target_language': 'Sen kan vi äta middag', 'native_language': 'Then we can have dinner'}, {'words': [{'narrator_translation': "||På|| means 'at'.", 'target_language': 'på'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Restaurangen|| means 'the restaurant'.", 'target_language': 'restaurangen'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Som|| means 'that'.", 'target_language': 'som'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Har dykt upp|| means 'has appeared'.", 'target_language': 'har dykt upp'}, {'narrator_translation': "||Nyligen|| means 'recently'.", 'target_language': 'nyligen.'}], 'narrator_translation': "||På restaurangen|| means 'at the restaurant'. ||Som har dykt upp nyligen|| means 'that has appeared recently'.", 'target_language': 'på restaurangen som har dykt upp nyligen.', 'native_language': 'at the restaurant that has recently appeared.'}]}]
